frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe the manipulation of an Entity by an Agent.
An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of  Group.
An Entity changes from a Prior_state to a Post_state in a sequence that follows a pre-defined plan, expectation, or model of change.

This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2).
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
This frame consists of words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial_value) to an end point (Final_value).
frameExamples: I <t>added</t> a new rock to my collection.
Their offensive armament has <t>developed</t> from short range missiles to long-range ballistic weaponry in a relatively short period .
The company is <t>raising</t> the final dividend from 4.34p to 4.57p, to boost the total by 5.3 percent to 6.36p.
Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
Hawke's Bay winery <t>doubled</t> in size last year.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates an object. <fen>Agent</fen> typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects.  <fen>Agent</fen> is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs:
The <fen>Entity</fen> being manipulated often occurs as the direct object of verbs:

The part of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s body being used to manipulate the <fen>Entity</fen> may also be expressed. While the default is for an <fen>Agent</fen> to use his/her hands, other body parts may be specified. This frame element usually occurs as a PP-complement.
When the manipulation takes place
The spatial setting in which the manipulation takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a volitional animate being who causes the <fen>New_member</fen> to become part of the <fen>Group</fen>.
Something that is already a member of the <fen>Group</fen> and represents the <fen>Group</fen> as a whole.
An item that becomes a part of the <fen>Group</fen>.

The <fen>Group</fen> is anything that can be conceptualized as a complex collection of parts or ingredients, including through metonymy like containers or locations, which <fen>New_member</fen>s can join.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that is responsible for causing a <fen>New_member</fen> to enter a <fen>Group</fen>.
This role identifies when the inclusion of the <fen>New_member</fen> to the <fen>Group</fen> occurs.
The location in which a <fen>New_member</fen> is entered into a pre-existing <fen>Group</fen>.
The object that undergoes change.
The time at which the progress occurs.
The location where the Progress occurs.
The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).
The scale along which the <fen>Item</fen> ranges in value.
The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the value of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> is a scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The entity that has a position on the scale.
The distance by which an <fen>Item</fen> changes its position on the scale.
The position on the scale where the <fen>Item</fen> ends up.
The initial position on the scale from which the <fen>Item</fen> moves away.
A portion of the scale, typically identified by its end points, along which the values of the <fen>Attribute</fen> fluctuate.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state before the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change of position occurs.
A location where Attribute is measured
listRoleExamples: <fex>A robot arm</fex> grasps the box on the conveyor belt and seals it.
Squeeze <fex>the ball</fex> as many times as you can.
Kim grasped the needle <fex>between finger and thumb</fex>.
I seized the letter <fex>before he did</fex>.
<fex>In the hallway</fex> he managed to grabthe monarch by the ankles
<fex>Matt</fex> seems to add new work to his flickr most days.
The companyincludes philanthropic endeavors in their accomplishments
<fex>The calls of crows</fex> added an eerie aspect to the atmosphere of our date.
Advances <fex>in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.
<fex>When</fex> did the X-wing progress beyond the drawing board?
They increased <fex>the price of oil</fex>.
<fex>Oil</fex> prices were raised yesterday.
<fex>The rain</fex> increased the river's flow rate to an astonishing million gallons per second.
As a result, they raised prices <fex>in Peoria</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
Oil rose <fex>in price</fex> by 2%.
I fear <fex>this service</fex> will diminish in quality.
Oil rose in price <fex>by 2%</fex>.
Microsoft shares fell <fex>to 7 5/8</fex>.
Microsoft shares fell <fex>from 12 3/8</fex> to 7 5/8.
The patient's temperature fluctuated <fex>between 28.5 and 29.5</fex>.
Diesels have increased <fex>from having a 20% market share in 1995</fex> to just over 30% in 2004.

It was never bad (1 or 2 seizures a year), but this past decade, it has increased
<fex>to having them 1 day a month</fex> and on that 1 day I have 6 or 7 seizures.
